newsitem.title: EGYPT: Egypt's heater manufacturer to issue shares.
newsitem.headline: Egypt's heater manufacturer to issue shares.

text.p: Egypt's Cairo Precision Industries, an affiliate of the Olympic Electric group of companies, on Tuesday offered investors 300,000 new shares worth some 25 million pounds ($7 million) to finance production activities.

The minimum application accepted will be for 25 shares at a fixed price of 85.00 pounds plus 0.50 pounds as issuance fees per share, the firm said in a published announcement. The shares are rarely traded on the Egyptian bourse.
Applications will be accepted for 60 days from December 24, the firm said. The offer, however, can be closed after at least 10 days in the eventof it being covered.
The Commercial International Bank and Commercial International Investment Company are working as agents.

The share offer will cut the parent company's stake in the heater manufacturer from about 62 percent. The group has just recently sold off a part of its 80 percent stake, a brokerage source told Reuters.
"The group will keep its majority stake after the issue," she said.
Other parties, including mutual funds and banks, now hold the remaining 38 percent of 1.5 million shares in the firm.

The firm said it has approved a scheme that would allow the group employees to own a maximum of five percent of the shares. It was not clear whether it covers the new issue or existing shares as well.
Cairo Precision was set up in 1991, but the parent company Olympic Electric has been producing water heaters for 33 years.
Cairo Precision's shareholders equity rose to 18.841 million pounds in calendar 1995 from 11.353 million in the previous year, the firm added.
It forecast net after tax profits to increase to 19.046 million pounds in 1997 from 15.931 in 1996. A group official said earlier this month profits were 14.755 million in the previous year.
He also said net sales would also rise to 59.968 million pounds this year from 53.849 million in 1995.
